intro: Oenanthe seseloides, commonly known as narrowleaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive silvery-blue hue on the underside. The small white flowers bloom in umbels, giving it a delicate and clustered appearance.
